title: Bump version in cargo.toml and package.json to 1.2.0
Bump y18n from 4.0.0 to 4.0.1
body:
Bumps [y18n](https://github.com/yargs/y18n) from 4.0.0 to 4.0.1.
Changelog

Sourced from y18n's changelog.

Change Log

All notable changes to this project will be documented in this file. See standard-version for commit guidelines.

5.0.5 (2020-10-25)

Bug Fixes

  • address prototype pollution issue (#108) (a9ac604)

5.0.4 (2020-10-16)

Bug Fixes

  • exports: node 13.0 and 13.1 require the dotted object form with a string fallback (#105) (4f85d80)

5.0.3 (2020-10-16)

Bug Fixes

  • exports: node 13.0-13.6 require a string fallback (#103) (e39921e)

5.0.2 (2020-10-01)

Bug Fixes

  • deno: update types for deno ^1.4.0 (#100) (3834d9a)

5.0.1 (2020-09-05)

Bug Fixes

  • main had old index path (#98) (124f7b0)

5.0.0 (2020-09-05)

⚠ BREAKING CHANGES

  • exports maps are now used, which modifies import behavior.
  • drops Node 6 and 4. begin following Node.js LTS schedule (#89)

Features

  • add support for ESM and Deno #95) (4d7ae94)

... (truncated)

Commits
  • See full diff in compare view
Maintainer changes

This version was pushed to npm by oss-bot, a new releaser for y18n since your current version.

title: Add debug method to JS interface
body: for debugging the state of the JS module while it's on the page!

title: Use Clap crate to parse command line commands
body:
Also:
- Fix a bunch of pedantic clippy lints
- Use colored crate to make command line output nicer
- Add `break_on_file_error` config
- Deprecate `filename` in output config

My PR hygiene wasn't very good here. There's lots to test... I should come back and write more tests for all the small behavior changes I introduced here.

title: Remove inaccurate "optimal"
body: Hosting js files locally is not any slower compared to CDNs and may be even faster because all modern browsers separate caches by domain.

title: Use semantic HTML for search highlight
body:
Use the `<mark>` tag to highlight the search result, to increase semantics. 
See https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/mark#usage_notes second bullet point.

title: If src_url is missing from file, assume value is url field instead
body:
Now, the config file can look like:

```toml
[input]
html_selector = "main > article.post > .single__content"

[[input.files]]
url = "https://bowdoinorient.com/2021/02/19/from-zoom-hangouts-to-soup-cans-bowdoins-crew-team-gets-creative-during-social-distancing/"
title = "From Zoom hangouts to soup cans: Bowdoin’s crew team gets creative during social distancing"

[[input.files]]
url = "https://bowdoinorient.com/2021/02/19/pond-hockey-until-watson-opens-womens-hockey-stays-focused-on-virtual-team-bonding/"
title = "Pond hockey: until Watson opens women’s hockey stays focused on virtual team bonding"

[[input.files]]
url = "https://bowdoinorient.com/2021/02/19/embracing-technology-and-social-media-bowdoin-athletics-masters-new-tools-for-recruiting/"
title = "Embracing technology and social media, Bowdoin athletics masters new tools for recruiting"
```

instead of

```toml
[input]
html_selector = "main > article.post > .single__content"

[[input.files]]
src_url = "https://bowdoinorient.com/2021/02/19/from-zoom-hangouts-to-soup-cans-bowdoins-crew-team-gets-creative-during-social-distancing/"
url = "https://bowdoinorient.com/2021/02/19/from-zoom-hangouts-to-soup-cans-bowdoins-crew-team-gets-creative-during-social-distancing/"
title = "From Zoom hangouts to soup cans: Bowdoin’s crew team gets creative during social distancing"

[[input.files]]
src_url = "https://bowdoinorient.com/2021/02/19/pond-hockey-until-watson-opens-womens-hockey-stays-focused-on-virtual-team-bonding/"
url = "https://bowdoinorient.com/2021/02/19/pond-hockey-until-watson-opens-womens-hockey-stays-focused-on-virtual-team-bonding/"
title = "Pond hockey: until Watson opens women’s hockey stays focused on virtual team bonding"

[[input.files]]
src_url = "https://bowdoinorient.com/2021/02/19/embracing-technology-and-social-media-bowdoin-athletics-masters-new-tools-for-recruiting/"
url = "https://bowdoinorient.com/2021/02/19/embracing-technology-and-social-media-bowdoin-athletics-masters-new-tools-for-recruiting/"
title = "Embracing technology and social media, Bowdoin athletics masters new tools for recruiting"
```

title: Fix JS idempotency bugs (by rearchitecting the module)
Fix build script so it works on fresh clone
Improve build stats script
body: Rewrite stats script to run benchmarks via `cargo criterion` and output JSON, fixing up a launchtime pain point.

title: Index content from the web
body:
I've been working on this on [Twitch](https://twitch.tv/jameslittle230)! This feature will probably go out in 1.2.0.

Closes #11

title: Read TOML configuration from stdin
body:
Closes #142 

Usage:

```bash
$ cat ./my-config-file.toml | stork --build
```

title: Add tests for WasmQueue JS module
Restrict Prettier to the /js directory
body:
Hi! First-time contributor here 👋
Add a `.prettierignore` file so that Prettier only operates on the `/js` directory. (TIL: about negative patterns — https://github.com/prettier/prettier/issues/3328)
This closes https://github.com/jameslittle230/stork/issues/136

title: Allow user to define custom WASM url in stork.initialize()
body:
Allow users to define a custom WASM URL.

This will add a "use at your own risk" kind of situation, since I won't be able to verify that the WASM loaded is the right WASM built to work with that version of the Javascript. However, this is required to implement self-hosting Stork, so the benefits outweigh the costs here. I'll add documentation to make it clear that you're taking your frontend into your own hands if you do this.

This PR closes #101.

title: Split Javascript API into multiple methods
body:
Adds four new JS methods on the `stork` Javascript object:

- One that downloads the WASM blob
- One that downloads the index and saves it into the WASM runtime's memory
- One that hooks into DOM elements
- One that lets you search the saved index from Javascript, in case you want to build your own DOM management

This should allow for more custom Stork interactions from within your own Javascript. This could be used to build a reactive downloader as described in #102, or could be used to build a completely custom DOM handler as described in #129.

This PR closes #102.

### Known Issues

- [x] `stork.attach()` might not be idempotent. Somehow, results are being logged to the console three different times.

title: Add onResultsHidden, onInputCleared, and showCloseButton to JS config
Improve development experience
body:
- Add benchmarks
- Improve getting-started experience by refactoring yarn scripts and adding info to the readme

title: Return an index generation error if there are no valid files
body:
- Fixes a bug where file parse errors were being printed twice (whoops!)
- Returns an index generation error (and errors out nicely) if none of the files are valid, instead of panicking with a divide-by-zero error

title: Helpfully handle hyphens when generating and searching through an index
body: Fixes #110

title: Fix some Javascript bugs that have popped up
body:
This:
- Fixes #116 
- Fixes #109 
- Removes some stray console output
- Fixes error states after loading the index so it doesn't try to load an index that's a 404 page

title: Collect and display indexing errors instead of failing early
body:
In #105, @fauno points out that a file that cannot be indexed will fail the entire indexing process, and points out an issue with this methodology:

> The issue is that it doesn't tell me which page is missing it. Could it tell the path and maybe even skip the page?

This PR changes the indexing behavior so that if a word list generation error is encountered, the code looping through each file collects that error and associates it with the failing file, then prints out the list of errors during indexing, without failing the entire indexing process:

```
2 errors while indexing files:
- Error indexing `myFile.html`: HTML selector `.article` is not present in the file.
- Error indexing `myOtherFile.txt`: The file could not be found
```

This should clarify what is failing and why.

To fully fix #105, I also need to write better documentation describing how Stork handles HTML files -- that's coming later.

title: Fix highlight offsets when excerpt contains multi-byte characters
body: Fixes #94

title: Bump coverage to 57%
body: based on https://github.com/jameslittle230/stork/pull/98#issuecomment-751813011

title: Don't break loop if an unnormalizable word is found
body: Fixes #95 (I think)

title: Copy *.st instead of specific index files
body: This prevents Webpack from erroring if one of the test index files can’t be found, which is nice since they’re all technically optional

title: Change typeof checks to null checks.
body:
Resolves #92 

Since this project uses TypeScript, using `typeof` to check types instead of relying on the compiler can cause some tricky errors, such as the one described in #92. This change changes the type checks in `entityDom.ts` to be null checks, which is a more robust way of checking for `undefined`.

A nice side-effect of this is that it obviates the need for some of the manual `assert` statements, since the compiler verifies that type signature for us.

body: This reverts commit 083fe54cda471ac021c031c3e7468d8818aba2ba.

title: Configure minimum prefix/search string length with ideograph consideration
body: Closes #73

title: Split WASM API into register and search step
Build artifacts on macOS in GH action
Move stork-search module mocks out of root
Lift per_file_input_config outside of loop to avoid a potentially expensive clone
body:
My input config had 118,000 file object - each with DataSource::Contents - so we were spending tons (n * n) of time cloning here when it's not necessary

By hoisting the clone out of the loop and mutating thereafter, we avoid the expensive cloning.

This reduced my index build time from just under 3 hours to 55 seconds

body: Fixes #69

title: Add "Powered by Stork" UI, close button, and esc-to-close
Add Jest test framework
body:
- Calculates code coverage and (hopefully) uploads to codecov
- Adds a test for the config module

title: Use keyboard to navigate results
body:
- Creates Entity TS class
- Brings the `domUpdate` function into that Entity class
- Also extracts things into the `indexLoader` module
- Primes the loading interface when it starts downloading (instead of on progress) so that users have more visual feedback when the index is loading

title: Use different serialization engine to reduce wasm size
Search returns a Result type
body:
Search can fail now, without panicking!
Made possible by a much more strongly typed index version parser

The error value doesn't get used in Javascript, but it could.

This PR also rearranges some files to make the filesystem structure better and more idiomatic

title: Index content in titles
body: Also adds an optional configuration option to determine how much a result should get "boosted" in the list, based on search results found in titles

title: SRT file support
body: Closes #6

title: Fix CI in master
body:
Changing the type of `Fields` from `Option<Hashmap<String, String>>` to `Hashmap<String, String>` broke bincode deserialization.

I ultimately want to change this, but probably can segment it out into index versions

title: Refactor JS to remove Handlebars
body:
Handlebars is far too big a dependency for the limited functionality I'm getting from it. Let's just use template strings instead.

This does mean that the `listItemTemplateString` config key is no more, and that people (for now) can't customize the elements being added to the DOM. This would technically be a breaking change if anyone were using Stork.

I think we'll need to make sure that the content is being appropriately escaped; in other words, I think this is vulnerable as-is if the index content contains malicious content.

title: Rewrite search algorithm
body:
- Use a more general intermediate data structure to turn index into `OutputResults`. This allowed me to add aliases for words that have the same stem (thanks, @grenierdev!)
    - Still to do: make those stems themselves aliases, then stem queries and resolve results for words that aren't in the corpus. I think this requires >1 levels of alias resolving, so I'm saving it for later (this diff is already big enough yeesh)
- Rewrite scoring to be more intuitive
    - This lets me do fun stuff like heavily de-score stopwords
    - Hopefully this will save me some sanity down the line
- Build up my struct trait implementations so I can write more conventional Rust and use methods like `.dedup()`

title: Handle, highlight, and sort multi-word queries
body: Closes #7

title: Fix CI config after updated dependencies
Implement result and excerpt scoring and sorting
Change `.stork-result a` selector so colors work
body: Fixes #20

title: Add cargo fmt check to CI
Merge in from rewrite
body:
https://github.com/jameslittle230/stork-rewrite

Moves all old code to `archive` directory

... sorry

title: Enhance the Javascript UI
body:
This is a breaking JS change, but nobody uses Stork yet so it's ok.

- Adds Handlebars as a JS dependency for compiling the template.
- Standardizes model vs view handling in JS.
- Does a lot better job adding and removing elements from the DOM, which should fix #2 .
- Adds optional config variable to the `register` method to enable or disable the new progress bar feature

title: Rewrite indexer and refactor into different packages
